sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Registering wscript to autostart run key for dropped js/vbs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Defense Evasion Via Rename Of Highly Relevant Binaries
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Matthew Green - @mgreen27, Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), frack113

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect creation of suspicious executable file name. Some strings look for suspicious file extensions, others look for filenames that exploit unquoted service paths.

Detect creation of suspicious executable file names.
Some strings look for suspicious file extensions, others look for filenames that exploit unquoted service paths.
Detects attempts of decoding encoded Gzip archives via PowerShell.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of the "PSScriptPolicyTest" PowerShell script by an uncommon process. This file is usually generated by Microsoft Powershell to test against Applocker.
Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Creation of an Executable by an Executable
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of an executable by another executable

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (65536u), with no line terminators

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered downloader. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

trid.file_type: file seems to be plain text/ASCII
